intro: Ludwigia peploides var. montevidensis, commonly known as the Montevidensis Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and pond margins, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, adding visual interest to aquatic landscapes. This variant is often cultivated in water gardens for its ornamental value and ability to provide habitat for aquatic life.
